website_summaries.verdict: This two-piece set makes an ideal foundation for multiple layers of clothing because of its thin construction and moisture-wicking ability.
pros: Polyester/spandex blend allows for four-way stretching
Available in black, gray, navy, and white
Suitable for both indoors and outdoors
Does not add bulk under clothes
Fibers woven with argan oil for softness
cons: Some reports of darker dyes bleeding into furniture and clothing
Sizing and fit can be variable

customer_reviews.title: False Advertising
customer_reviews.text: The MEN'S thermal set shows the opening on the pants so that a man can pee standing up. The package I received shows the opening on the pants, but the actual product DID NOT have the opening. Why on earth would you make MEN'S underwear without an opening - that makes them WOMEN'S underwear!!!! They are very soft and warm, but not practical for a man. Very disappointed. I was hoping to order more pairs after Christmas - guess I will look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Boyd

customer_reviews.title: Good for a cheap (unseen) layer
customer_reviews.text: Soft but poorly sewn. Reasonable fabric, but very poor construction.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Oh so toasty!
customer_reviews.text: Oh so toasty! Fit great and very warm. I sort of ordered by mistake thinking I was getting my old time Woolrich longies and was initially disapointed not to have cottom lined wool I have been using for over 50 years. However once trying on just for the heck of it they fit great and are actually warmer that the old wool stuff. My how technology has progressed faster than I. Mine did have a fly, unlike other reviewers that said no fly so maybe they listened to buyer feed back. I guess I am moving to the new high tech life now.
customer_reviews.author: bud e. :-)

customer_reviews.title: Good product. Poor fit.
customer_reviews.text: Super thin, actually warm, fits a lose on the tops, but perfect on the bottoms. Honestly, the shirt part would wrinkle up as an undergarment because of how much extra material there is. If you have a barrel chest, normal arms, normal torso length, and normal shoulders - i guess its ok, but who tf is this shirt made for?
customer_reviews.author: UserID

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made / nice and warm though.
customer_reviews.text: Very warm and comfortable. 1 star deducted for not having a fly on Mens' long underwear. So I have to drop my pants to go?! That's stupid and not well thought out. Another star deducted for lack of construction quality control. The neck line collar on mine is off by an eighth of an inch and just sewn together like that. It''s obvious to the eye. They should spend less on the fancy packaging and work on bringing the quality of their work up to standard. Warm and comfortable\ budget construction.
customer_reviews.author: Karl Swanson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit (I got medium, and I am 5' 10" 175 lbs). Also, awesomely warm for upstate NY! Very soft, smooth material, not itchy at all. I have worn them under regular clothes and under my bike clothes and they are great either way.
customer_reviews.author: John J Vaughn

customer_reviews.title: He loves them
customer_reviews.text: Got the X large for my husband they were a little snug but he loves them and says they are very comfortable, he has worn them all day
customer_reviews.author: jessica walker

customer_reviews.title: Stitching off around waste but fixable. Fits as expected.
customer_reviews.text: Fits as expected. Husband is 6'1" 198 got a large son is 5'6" 135 got a medium. Stitching around waste was off but I can fix it. Live in Florida, got these for a trip to Alaska. When you buy boys black outfits they want to put them on and be ninjas 😂
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: The black thermals stained our couches
customer_reviews.text: There is something defective with these thermals. We have white couches and I have worn and washed this Thermal numerous times, the color of the black rubs off on our couch. Basically ruining one of our couches. The Thermal does keep you warm, but I can't recommend this product whatsoever. I've purchased black thermals before and nothing like this where the color rubs off. If the seller wants to make this right, contact us. I will post an update and change to 2 stars, but long term if you own white furniture and plan to wear these around the house on occassion DO NOT PURCHASE
customer_reviews.author: agoshtas

customer_reviews.title: SIZE DID NOT MATCH PACKAGING OR ORDER
customer_reviews.text: Ordered an XL for my boyfriend for a ski trip to Tahoe. Got the zip loc bag style package and read that it said XL on the package so we packed it. Get to Tahoe, about to go skiing, my boyfriend pulls out these and they are size MEDIUM. He had no choice but to wear them and be uncomfortable in them the entire time because they were too tight. They kept him warm, but buyer beware make sure that you take these out of the package before taking them with you to make sure they are the right size!!! Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: I don't like the fact that I bought something that I got ...
customer_reviews.text: These are supposed to be long johns for men with no fly hole, there leotard for women!! I don't like the fact that I bought something that I got to take my pants down just to go to the bathroom and if I'm wearing hunting gear I have to take the damn thing off!! just to get to what I got to do!! I don't know who made them or call them men's
customer_reviews.author: Ray Roush

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product
customer_reviews.text: DONT BUY!! I ordered xl, the bottoms are 36 waist and 34 length. The pew slit is exactly that, just a slit, does not overlap itself, can't wear without undies. Top, wow!! Neck was so stretched that it sat where my collar bone meets my shoulder. So! If you have a 36 waist, reaaaaallllly long legs and a neck the size of a body builder. Then its perfect for you. Cheap cheap cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not happy
customer_reviews.text: Check your package, I received someone else’s dirty return with hair in them.
customer_reviews.author: Stupid Spender

customer_reviews.title: Soft, yes. Warm, absolutely not!
customer_reviews.text: From the reviews I have read, this item used to be amazing. I heard they were warm and comfortable. Then, they changed distributors. I received an open package which is obviously disappointing. But, they are very confortable. However, I bought this for working outside in the Midwest in the winter. For that, I cannot recommend this item. It is in no way warm. I pretty much use it under long johns because long johns are itchy.
customer_reviews.author: Thaikickurface

customer_reviews.title: Poor fitting garment.
customer_reviews.text: I am 10' 9" , weigh 160 lbs and my size is always MEDIUM. I bought this outfit for my trip to Canada. The top is tight with short sleeves, 3" above my wrist, and the bottom is tight, has short inseam that makes it uncomfortable and short at the hip and pelvic area, and the legs are very long . This outfit top part was small size and the bottom part was for a 6'5" tall person. I don't know what sizing chart they were following. It was a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: M. Mehanni

customer_reviews.title: Not warm at all
customer_reviews.text: The only good thing about them is they are soft. I read other reviews saying order a size larger so I did. I ordered a double xx and they sent me a xl in a double xx package. They are very tight and not warm at all. I have to wear two different sets of long underwear when wearing them. They are like wearing nothing at all.
customer_reviews.author: Lonnie and Angel

customer_reviews.title: Brands and quality vary
customer_reviews.text: Loved the first set by Thermatec and ordered two more. The next two sets by a company called Snow Love were different brands, different weight and not as good. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: eternaloptimist

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Fit, Snug and Warm
customer_reviews.text: They were a perfect fit. I'm 5'6" and 132 lbs with a 28 inch waist. I ordered a small. They are incredibly soft and I didn't want to take them off after trying them on. I have broad shoulders and found the sleeve length could be a tad longer. I'm used to wearing another brand that has the thumb holds. I could probably get away with wearing these in a yoga class. I wore the top to work on a casual day and you no one would know it's a thermal undershirt.
customer_reviews.author: Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: WAY too short!!!
customer_reviews.text: OMG, if you are taller than 5’2”, do NOT buy this product. I bought two sets for my son for our trip to Iceland. Poor kid. He’s 6’4” and on the thin/fit side, so I thought the size large would be plenty big for him. Oh my no! The pants were so short, they barely went to his mid-calf. I’m 5’10” and the pants were even too short for me! And the shirt didn’t go past his belly button. Come on guys, your size large should be regular American large, not munchkin large. Complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Beeps

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: There are two completely different products being sold. I first bought two sets of these on 10/3 and got long johns of decent quality. I ordered three more sets on 10/18 and I am not pleased because it's not the same.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah Coolbreeze

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I have very sensitive skin. There are clothes that I absolutely cannot wear, for everywhere I walk I can feel the fabric scratching against my skin. So, I always have a hard time choosing comfortable long johns, because wearing them feels like a form of torture. Given all that, this is the best long johns I have ever worn. Definitely will buy from them again if I need more. Also, a tip, there is nothing wrong with a slightly bigger long johns, so when buying, do buy on the larger size. I have, and it is fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Impressed with the purchase
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a size larger than I thought I'd need. I ordered Black and received Black. The bottoms have an opening as described. I'm a backpacker and intend to use them for sleepwear as well as layers when needed. They do develop some BO after a few days of wearing them 24 hours a day, but that's to be expected. I have no complaints and as it stands would certainly order them again if needed. No remorse, no regrets!
customer_reviews.author: myrrick

customer_reviews.title: Not that warm
customer_reviews.text: Ive been using long underwear for years, specifically the cotton waffle style. These are NOT THAT WARM. Fact is, I just ordered the old style LJ's made of cotton, waffle style since I know they will keep me warm unlike these that let a lot of cold in. Plus, they are difficult to get on and off since they are made of a man made fiber and stretch no matter how you put them on or off, its almost like a chinese handcuff where the more you pull, the tighter they get. My suggestion is, stick with cotton.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Top fits; bottom is for short people.
customer_reviews.text: I tried so hard to love these... even bought a gray set after returning the black (reviewers say the black is not colorfast)...because the fleece, though rather skimpy, feels nice against my skin. They seem to be constructed well with a soft waistband (not a hard/rough elastic one), and they do feel warm, though I never got to try them where it really matters -- in cold country! However, I'd have to be 4 inches shorter to love the bottoms.... and heaven forbid, don't bend over! Pay heed to the reviews when it comes to size, honestly, especially if you're over 5'5." Even then, they'd have been 2" too short, and I am not overweight.
customer_reviews.author: jm

customer_reviews.title: Super warm, stretchy and soft long underwear
customer_reviews.text: My husband is from Costa Rica and this is his first winder in the cold north. He started feeling chilly, so we looked at Walmart for long johns, but they were not soft and they were about $15 for either pants or the shirt. This is the second set I have ordered in a week because he wears them every day. They are super warm and soft on the inside and thin enough to fit under your shirt comfortably. The fit is great, he is a big and tall guy 6'6''+ and 290 lbs so they are perfect. Some people say they are not the best quality stitching, but really the fit and fabric makes up for that.
customer_reviews.author: Matilda

customer_reviews.title: Short and fat? Go bigger
customer_reviews.text: Dosent run true to size as expected, runs pretty slim. I would recommend ordering a size or two over
customer_reviews.author: Sirjozef

customer_reviews.title: Runs Very Small...FANTASTIC Otherwise.
customer_reviews.text: I thought these were for big and tall MEN. I got XXXL for a very big and tall MAN. These are a little tight on ME. I am a 5'7" and 150lb GIRL. I even had to pull the waist a bit to tear the elastic, and STILL snug. I could see if I were pregnant or something, but seriously: Do they expect a big and tall dude to wear this?? Other than that, they really are lovely. The color is gorgeous, the material is soft, slick and silky. So, if you are a GIRL: These are wonderful. If you are a 6'3" 250lb or so DUDE: Forget it, pal.
customer_reviews.author: Rhayzza

customer_reviews.title: Poor craftsmanship.
customer_reviews.text: Got about 2 weeks ago. Washed as directed once prior to use and wore the top for 2 days. When I took the top off and inspected it prior to washing it again there was a thread about 3 feet long hanging from the bottom of the garment. A section approximately 8 inches long has become unravelled at the bottom of the hem. Very disappointing, the materials seem adequate other than that and seem warm enough for the intended purpose. Need the garment for wear so no time for a return, trying to self repair with fabric glue. Poor craftsmanship and a disappointing initial experience.
customer_reviews.author: richard  robinson

customer_reviews.title: Looking to wear in the future, but enjoying it in the present
customer_reviews.text: This is long under ware in the future. I haven’t purchased long under since my children were children. That was probably in the 1990’s. It’s so impressive how far the fabric, comfort, and fit has improved. I purchased this for my husband. It was the first time I’ve ever purchased long underwear for him. He was impressed with my selection. He liked the lightness of the fabric and the comfort without a waffle pattern all over your body. It also kept him warm without being over heated. Thanks for your impressive underware
customer_reviews.author: Sandi Gillespie

customer_reviews.title: Good winter investment
customer_reviews.text: Bought this off of a recommendation from my nephew around the holidays. At the time, it wasn’t terrible as far as winter weather was concerned but decided to get a pair for when it does get cold. Fast forward to today. Knowing the forecast was going to be cold (overnight temps in the single digits and rising into the low twenties), I wore these underneath my work clothes (I work outside) and despite a slight chill on occasion, it kept the harshest part of the cold away from my body. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Haitsma

customer_reviews.title: Cottony soft
customer_reviews.text: WHEN i ordered the Ultra Soft Thermal Underwear set- i had no idea how soft and cottony they are. My boyfriend, doesnt want to take off You can sleep in them. They are not snug for circulation. They fit great under a jean or carpenter style pants. I ordered a Large- it fits perfect. I in fact, ordered a second set- so to have two on hand-took a chance- Price is Right- Fit is perfect. These thermal s are not like the thermal puffy style. Pure cotton no ripples You will be very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: APHRODI

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and fit well.
customer_reviews.text: It’s actually too soon to give a meaningful evaluation, as I bought them for a forthcoming trip to Antarctica. Both pieces fit very well - I’m 5’10 and 175 lbs, and let’s be kind and say I have an older person’s body shape! I purchased L size. They are much more comfortable (based on initial try-on) than I expected, and I am sure they will serve me well. I will certainly buy a second pair if the tour itinerary indicates more than one or two zodiac landings!
customer_reviews.author: Azinaz

customer_reviews.title: They do keep you warm
customer_reviews.text: These synthetic material long johns do perform as advertised, keeping you warm without adding much bulk to your outfit. I wore them through a variety of activities in the Austrian Alps during February and was comfortable all day long. I didn't wear them during strenuous activity (crosscountry skiing, etc.) as they would definitely be too warm. But when appropriate, these long johns worked great, perhaps better than the silks I had along on my trip as well. Just a nice overall product.
customer_reviews.author: pksimons

customer_reviews.title: Runs very small.  Get two or three sizes up.  Size chart is wrong.
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable and lightweight, but still warm. I'd usually get a L in these, but saw some of the questions and reviews and got an XXL. It's still small, and I'm not that big of a guy, 6', 175lbs, 33W, 34L. 2XL was the largest they had when I bought them, so if you're more than a 34W&L (maybe 36), probably need a 3XL or another brand.
customer_reviews.author: GJ

customer_reviews.title: Runs small take into consideration. Otherwise very nice
customer_reviews.text: These have a much nicer fly than the ones we ordered in November 2018. But we noticed that the 2X ordered in November were a little smallish so this time we ordered a 3X. It actually fits tighter than the 2X but He likes the fly much better because it keeps things contained better. I would give this a five star rating if it wouldn’t be for the fit. It’s made in China I don’t think they know whether to ask person is in America or what or 3X person is and it gets irritating to have to keep ordering do you try to get things right I wish things were more standard everywhere not just here.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth B Waldvogel

customer_reviews.title: Great for staying warm !
customer_reviews.text: This item does what it promises, it keeps you warm in this cold weather . A plus as well if you live alone , keep these on and turn down the thermostat. If you're looking to lower your heating costs. I ordered a large size and the tights more so the top , feels like a compression garment , so you may want to go a size larger then you think you need. Might be one of my best buys this year !
customer_reviews.author: csmith8354

customer_reviews.title: Really well made!
customer_reviews.text: My dad had me order him one for using on the golf course. It was a little too small (but that's because he's bigger than he thinks *wink). We got him a XX and it was so good he asked me to order him another one. We didn't return the first one. Mom washed it (and this is when she said, "Wow these are really well made"), and Dad gave it to his slightly more slender golfing buddy. So now they both have them. So we've purchased three all total.
customer_reviews.author: Rain

customer_reviews.title: Saved my life
customer_reviews.text: It literally was colder in front of my apartment building than at the North Pole during the arctic vortex this winter. I would walk outside and ice would instantly coat my beard. This first winter in Minnesota was rough to say the least. These quickly became my best friend and I cannot imagine surviving the worst of the cold months here without them. They’re snug and comfortable and I now own 3 pairs.
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: Fits snug - Perfect for hiking in waders in warmer Alaska Fly fishing
customer_reviews.text: They were great for 60-70 degree weather in Yakutat Alaska fly fishing for Sockeye on the river. Perfect to walk miles in warmer Alaska weather under your waders. WARNING: Your friends will make fun of your "sexy legs" if you walk around the cabin with these on. You have been warned.
customer_reviews.author: sac45310

customer_reviews.title: Best thermals I’ve bought in a long time!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my husband when we went snowboarding in WV and the high was in the single digits! Used these as his second layer, because it has an unbelievably soft inner fabric that insulated perfectly. It could easily be worn as a base layer, too! Rivals any more expensive thermals I’ve owned! Buy a size up. My husband wears large and XL fit him well!
customer_reviews.author: jax

customer_reviews.title: Great first impression!
customer_reviews.text: We just got these and my husband hasn't worn them in the cold yet (our cold season may be over!), but he really likes the feel of them and the fit. They definitely run small - he's typically a medium, but from the reviews we decided to order a large and it's pretty much the perfect fit - just loose enough to be comfortable. They are very soft and fleece-lined on the inside; looks like they will be very warm! We are not rating 5-star yet just because we don't know how they will be when worn and if they will hold up to washing.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey H.

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Quality !!!!
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with this product although it is soft and warm its cheap the stitching in the under arm started coming undone after the first time i wore it. Now have 3 holes all stitching coming undone 2 under arm 1 on the sleeve not worth the purchase do yourself a favor don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, but not terribly effective
customer_reviews.text: I decided to try these thermals, because they were relatively cheap and looked more comfortable than the classic "waffle" style thermals. Unfortunately, they're not much good at keeping out the cold (around 25 F when I wore them), and while they start off fine, they feel a bit odd after a whole day of wearing them. Not quite chaffing, but not comfortable, either. Bottom-line: I don't plan to return them, but neither would I recommend them. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny S.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and thin
customer_reviews.text: I'm getting this thermal underwear for my day who works as a construction worker and would need work outside in the winter. This is the top-selling and I was expecting a lot from it. First thing first, it is really thin and somewhat small. I would recommend getting a slightly lighter one. The fabric is fine but comes with a smell. Stitchings are okay. However, it is not keeping the heat as efficient as I expected. I guess this has to do with its thin layers.
customer_reviews.author: allen

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!! Great for school field trip
customer_reviews.text: My son was going on a week-long field trip and needed something to help keep him warm at night or at places that were especially windy. The moment he tried on the thermal underwear to see if they fit, he loved them so much that he didn't want to take them off. They were soft, comfortable, and warm. He was able to wear them underneath his pajamas and clothes without feeling bulky. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Katerina L.

customer_reviews.title: Fit is spot on, very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This set of long johns is exactly what I was looking for. I am 6'0", 205 pounds and the extra large fits me perfectly. I bought these to wear under jeans and chaps for riding my motorcycle in the cooler months. Tested them out last night and was extremely happy with how well they fit under my clothes and how well they performed for my specific use case. I like them enough that I am ordering 2 more sets.
customer_reviews.author: Shane D Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Keeps my husband warm and Not bulky...
customer_reviews.text: I bough these for my husband because he works outside... Well the day after we received these, my husband put them on because it was really cold outside... He told me that he loved the way they felt and it kept him nice and warm... now I am ordering my son a pair and of the womens for me... but it looks like now I need to order more and they will be great Christmas gifts... Really nice product... Nice and Thin and comfortable and does its job well keeping my husband warm...
customer_reviews.author: Regina Farris

customer_reviews.title: No pee hole
customer_reviews.text: The discription said it have the opening for the pee hole or whatever. I bought 3 and none have the pee hole
customer_reviews.author: Reb'l Fleur

customer_reviews.title: Keeps you warm!
customer_reviews.text: I got these underwear for my husband because he works outside all day on a daily basis, and his current long underwear were all in shreds. He wore them the first time with morning temperatures of 17 degrees and it did not get much warmer all day. He commented on how well they kept him warm, and that he did not get cold all day. He said they were comfortable and was pleased that they did not add any bulk. I am pleased with the price as well.
customer_reviews.author: Moody M

customer_reviews.title: Very Poorly Made But They Do The Job
customer_reviews.text: The pants of these Long Johns arrived with the one of the insides seems not fully sewn together just above the knee. I contacted the seller, Thermal J Brands, and they promptly sent me another full set, but the second set had the same problem. Other than the poor quality of the sewing or just poor quality control, these Long Johns work as advertised. If you don't mind sewing a brand new garment then these work, but I'll be looking at a different brand for next winter.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for cold nights
customer_reviews.text: Little sillier than I expected. Nothing wrong with it, just didn't realize the texture. These fit perfectly and keep me warm all night. Bought them because the nights have been cold and I didn't want to keep running my heater, but don't like the silliness of sweats to sleep in. These are amazing, comfortable, warm, and fit perfectly. Might buy them.in black also.
customer_reviews.author: D$w

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised!!!
customer_reviews.text: It wasn't exactly what I expected BUT that's not a bad thing and I may have misunderstood. The material appears to be breathable. The fit is VERY snug but when wearing under a work uniform that should be good. Not sure how warm they will be yet. It's not standard "longjohn" material. The fit and the material should make putting cloths on over them easier. The shirt is nice and long.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Monsue

customer_reviews.title: Finally Found the Right Thermals
customer_reviews.text: This pair of long johns is a must buy! I tried it today and I texted my wife immediately that aside from the softness of product, really keeps me warm in chillin’ Pittsburgh weather. We’ve been searching for the thermals and finally found the right product. The ones that we bought last year and 2 years back were not good. Either gave us discomfort (itchiness) or didn’t keep us warm. I will buy some more pairs.
customer_reviews.author: Rizaldy N.

customer_reviews.title: Sizing definitely seems to run small
customer_reviews.text: These are beautiful thermals, but the sizing definitely runs small. I got the medium (my standard size) and they were slightly uncomfortably tight (particularly the 'pants'), while the shirt was 'fitted' but not absurdly tight. I would suggest ordering up a size from your usual. Other than the sizing, they seem FANTASTIC. Super-soft and warm.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kent Layton

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and feel durable.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 4 total sets. They are very soft, feel very durable, are very comfortable and for the price I am quite satisfied. I would recommend these to anyone who works outdoors like myself. I am out in the weather from 6 in the morning to well into the evening and these keep me much warmer than my other fleece lined long johns. Good quality for the price, try then out for yourself.
customer_reviews.author: T.

customer_reviews.title: They're Warm!
customer_reviews.text: Is too warm such a thing? Wore these into .75 mile hike to deer stand on 29 degree morning and was pouring sweat by the time I got to the stand. These are very warm base layers. I'd recommend to wear them sparing on long hike in and just put on the top once you're where you're gonna be hunting. With that said I sat for 6 hours with these on even after sweating and stayed warm.
customer_reviews.author: edub20

customer_reviews.title: Two thumbs up
customer_reviews.text: Bought a set for my boyfriend. He can’t stop raving about it. Super soft, keeps him warm this time of year as he works outdoors. He’s usuallly a medium in clothing but I purchased large as recommended in reviews. Fits perfectly. So definitely order 1 size up. I plan on getting him a couple more sets! Amazing quality for a great price. He prefers these over the expensive under armor thermals he’s had in the past. Two thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: DEFINITELY NOT THERMALS.
customer_reviews.text: Very thin wind blows right through. Definitely are not Thermals. That should be false advertising. They don't keep you warm in any way. Does not wick moisture holds it and then you're damp and even colder. DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: No way
customer_reviews.text: My husband works outside daily, says he would be warmer in pantyhose. Too thin and do nothing for wind. Gonna stick with Hanes thermals. We live in Texas, so if they aren't good here I sure as heck would hate for someone up north to be stuck with these EXPENSIVE tights.
customer_reviews.author: Brandy

customer_reviews.title: Repeat customer
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 3 sets of these after receiving my first. Good quality, well priced and comfortable. Seems don't scratch (unlike tsla) and the fit is snug enough to contour your body but not feel like compression clothing. I'm 5'7" 182lbs and ordered large. I typically wear 34x30 jeans if that helps. Wife has also bought the ThermaJane sets after seeing mine.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: For the most part they worth the buy and do keep you warm. They fit and feel very comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: So it’s super comfortable. I rather the old-school style for when I go to work (they seem to keep me warmer). I use these mostly when I don’t want to wear a jacket and I’ll be outside just going to local events hanging with family.
customer_reviews.author: Waylon Jude

customer_reviews.title: Best I’ve come across
customer_reviews.text: Return purchaser. Would give 6 stars. Great set of thermal/long johns. Walked out the house many a cold night in just thermals. Put a layer over them and you’ll get toasty. By far superior to the classic itchy cotton ones I’ve purchased again and again over the years. Durable and don’t get droopy I’m the crotch and elastic worn out like the traditional style long john. Definitely going to continue to buy until I have a decent stockpile. Highly recommended. My only request would be for thumb holes on the wrists.
customer_reviews.author: Jack D.

customer_reviews.title: Think slippery!!!
customer_reviews.text: The long johns were nice and warm but they are so slippery that I spent all day pulling my trousers up and pulling my shirt down as it slid up every time I lifted my arms! Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Don B

customer_reviews.title: Not your old fashioned Long Underwear!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice soft material that fits body closely. Not your old fashioned cotton twill type long underwear that sagged at your crotch and butt. Pay close attention to the sizing chart. I am 66 years old, 5'8" and 230+. 3xl fit very well and I expect they will keep me warm for upcoming truck camping trip to the desert.
customer_reviews.author: Bob C.

customer_reviews.title: Not American size
customer_reviews.text: Could not use. Got large size but way too small
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sizing is odd but worked
customer_reviews.text: They are great and so soft didn’t expect it to be so warm. But anyway they only thing that is odd is the sizing I got medium for my dad. The long sleeve looks bigger then the bottoms. The bottoms look like a small rather then medium. My dad is short he’s 5’2 and the top would just need to be adjust from the sleeves the pants have stretch so he can fit he has semi skinny legs. If your a large go for XL if you bigger on the bottom side.
customer_reviews.author: Aileen G

customer_reviews.title: Seriously great thermal gear
customer_reviews.text: These are NOT the "long johns" your mother used to make you wear before going out to sled as a kid. They are sleek, comfortable, soft, great, and inexpensive. I wasn't really expecting much - just something warm to throw under my Carhartts or to bum around the house in...but these are absolutely fantastic. Going to get me another pair and probably get them for my brothers and dad. Really great product, really great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Davidson

customer_reviews.title: light grey, a little cheap
customer_reviews.text: I did get a fly (light grey). Some ordering different colors did not get the fly opening. I actually love them, but one year and they are wearing out already. They are good for keeping you warm around the house, and for light outdoor activity. The bottom of the legs is not elastic, but I pull my socks over them and they pretty much stay in place. I'm going to try something different this time.
customer_reviews.author: eTech

customer_reviews.title: BUYER BEWARE
customer_reviews.text: I am NOT happy with what I received. These are NOT thermals at all. They are spandex and the material and color is a sparkly black. The package says $39.99 and I wouldn't pay 1 cent for them. They are super thin. NOT what is advertised at all. Amazon needs to get this off their site before anymore people get ripped off.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Leach

customer_reviews.title: Good but slippery.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a good set of thermals and these seemed to fit the bill. They work great but the downside is the outside is too slippery and once had my pants slip down a couple of times even after tightening my belt. For warmth it works great! For under the clothes...not for me. I did wash them once before use but the slippery surface is still there.
customer_reviews.author: AntTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Turns skin blue, but good fit/style
customer_reviews.text: Good fit, however, everytime my husband wears it, it turns his skin blue. He has to use an exfoliator to get it out of his pores afterwards. Ive washed it a couple of times, nothing helps. Other than that, its great. I like that it doesnt lool like old man long johns.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey Ramsey

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and excellent insulation for cold weather.
customer_reviews.text: My husband used the Thermajohn underwear long john set for our recent trip to Utah over Christmas. Temperatures were anywhere from 16 to 25 degrees. They kept him warm walking around catching glimpses of grandkids skiing for hours at a time. He's 5'10" and 190 lbs. I bought the XL and they fit perfect. I bought two pairs. He loved them!
customer_reviews.author: northerntowngirl

customer_reviews.title: TRUE SIZES in a Undergarment highly needed.
customer_reviews.text: OK!!! I am 5'-11', 279lb. I am a true 4XL...THESE FIT WONDERFUL. I hope your sizes stay TRUE. To many foreign vendors here selling items on there scale of Lepracon for me. THIS I HABE ORDERED 3 MORE PAIR. But I news 9 more, like to have 14 on hand for the winder weeks....HIT ME WITH AND ORDER SOON.Ill buy.
customer_reviews.author: Elizah S.

customer_reviews.title: Great value for money.
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to buy them because of few negative reviews! No way, this product does his work (it keeps warm and comfortable) and has a great value for money. I am 6ft tall and 180lbs (athletic body shape), I got the Medium size, it fits very well (I am pretty sure will fit well even the large but a little bit more loose) and you can move in a very comfortable way. Buy it, it is a good choice!
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great Second Skin
customer_reviews.text: Fits like a second skin. Very comfortable. Has fly (which many do not) allowing no hassle pit stops. Great for taking the edge off of damp Northern California winters and cool spring weather. They make great pajamas! Bought a second pair because of the quality and competitive pricing. I usually take. size Large underwear but ordered an XL because I don’t like tight constricting underwear and tee shirts.
customer_reviews.author: Grunt

customer_reviews.title: Not as Warm
customer_reviews.text: I bought these "Long Johns" to replace a 20 year old pair of Fruit of the Loom. While the top is comfortable and warm the bottoms fall a little short. They do not keep me as warm as the old ones. I walk 6 miles a day starting at 4am in the morning and I need something to keep me warm during the winter months. I like the way they fit and feel just not as reliable as the old ones.
customer_reviews.author: ShelbyGT350

customer_reviews.title: Small
customer_reviews.text: Fit very short arms short torso short legs I went off of what their size guide was and I’m only 5 foot 11 but everything was short
customer_reviews.author: JIM MOHLER

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable - better than expected.
customer_reviews.text: They are warm, fit better than expected, will never buy any other type of thermals again! It’s not waffle style - it’s very smooth on both sides & stretchy for perfect and clingy fit. Amazing discovery!!
customer_reviews.author: Matty B

customer_reviews.title: A Tad Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Truth is not really satisfied. It’s comfortable, but it is not sized well. I’m clearly a large, almost a medium ordered a large and is a bit small. Also, wore it at a football game Met Life stadium. Skin was a bit cold, and temp was 39. I was expecting a bit warmer. With jeans and the long underwear
customer_reviews.author: SLW

customer_reviews.title: Ultra warm but really tight
customer_reviews.text: These long johns are really nice material. They are really warm. It's nice to be outside in the mid 40's without discomfort. The length for xl is perfect. My only complaint is that they are very tight. If you want a set of long johns that fit loosely, your best bet is to upsize. Happy winter days!
customer_reviews.author: joshua moore

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is the second pair that I purchased, the last one being a small and this one being a medium. It fit juuuust right, and I often wear the upper garment (long sleeve) as an undergarment under my T-shirts and other upper garments. The lower garment (like long underwear) is very nice as well, but I don't usually need it. It is 100% waay better than I thought it would turn out, soft, comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: EforEvery1

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointed.
customer_reviews.text: I bought Large and it was too small. I returned it. I bought XL and there isn't much difference size wise. More importantly, it doesn't really keep you warm. And you can't sleep in it since it is so tight.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur Bagirov

customer_reviews.title: Item is deceptive
customer_reviews.text: I wasted my time buying this. It was way too small. This is spandex. The description says fleece lined. The only fleece I got was taking my money by deception. It's very cold to the skin when outside in 32 degree temp. I'm just warning the next persons who think about buying this brand item
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: You may need an extra size up
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a size (L) at ~185 lbs / 5'11 It was a little to small unless you are looking for skintight, I would have needed another size up for my purposes. The company was very responsive, they worked to send me another pair before I went on the trip I ordered them for, and made the process very easy to navigate.
customer_reviews.author: David C.

customer_reviews.title: The thin version
customer_reviews.text: It was a little large. After washing I expect it to shrink a little. I was expecting the traditional Verizon but recieve the thin poly whatever. It kept me somewhat warm. I will get back after washing it.
customer_reviews.author: Oscar Garza

customer_reviews.title: Super cozy
customer_reviews.text: Comfy and soft just like the description, I wear these to bed on cold nights. They really keep me warm and cozy, after the first wash no shrinkage notice and feel just as soft as the first day. I recommend them get two in different colors dark and light and stay warm.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Big Time Pass
customer_reviews.text: The sizing is so far off base. On other products, XL is XL not on this product. XL size-The top is more like a medium/large and the bottoms more of a tight large. The thermal portion is poor at best, you never feel warm. No wind resistance, As someone that works in a cold enviroment, not worth spending your money. Guess I will go back to DuoFold and call it a day.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Get one size bigger!
customer_reviews.text: Really surprised with those Long Johns, the thermal pants are a must for freezing weather, and the shirt is nice too. Definitely recommend following the "get a size bigger than you usually get" guildeline from the commentors. As a short (5'7, 140lb), S size clothes are usually too big or too baggy for me, but the S sized long johns fit me perfectly! Already considering getting a 2nd set.
customer_reviews.author: Fernando Tsurukawa

customer_reviews.title: Great thermals!!
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves these. He is 6'4" so they are a wee bit short, but not bad. I would love to know if these are available longer for tall men that aren't heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl McMillan

customer_reviews.title: Great quality but smaller than you think when you look at the size marking
customer_reviews.text: I like this very much. It's my second purchase. You have to get at least one size bigger than you think you need though as it runs quite small. I have been Small to Medium all my life and only the Large fits me right. Take that into consideration when you're ordering.
customer_reviews.author: JMF12345

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected.
customer_reviews.text: The Thermajohn's fit nice a little tight, but comfortable. The reason for only 3 stars is because they don't work in the cold. As soon as I walk out into the cold I feel it. Not what I expected. Nothing like my polypropylene long johns. Sorry But they are great indoors where it is warm. Go Figure I'm just saying
customer_reviews.author: Richard H

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit and kept me warm!
customer_reviews.text: Family traveled to Iceland for a vacation. We all needed thermals. I am super sensitive to the cold, so I was hoping these would work really well. I did not want to invest in jackets, when I don't need them where I live. These worked perfectly. I was able to wear these thermals and just a light jacket and I was toasty warm.
customer_reviews.author: Abhi Visuvasam

customer_reviews.title: Keeps you warm.
customer_reviews.text: My husband hasn't worn long underwear for many years. He asked for some because it will be cold at work for a couple weeks. When they came, he was surprised by how fitted they were but he tried them one day and came home and asked for a second pair so I guess they're a hit!
customer_reviews.author: sewgirlseattle

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable, but not as warm as expected
customer_reviews.text: These are amazingly comfortable, and I love the stretchy (sports like) fabric. I was a little surprised they aren't as warm as I expected. I put them on just to test them out on a ~55* morning, and I was still cold a little cold. But definitely great to wear under a snow-grade dickies outfit.
customer_reviews.author: B.W.

customer_reviews.title: Super comfy!
customer_reviews.text: So I'll start with the caveat that I really don't have a frame of reference to compare these to any similar product because I haven't owned any type of long johns in a very long time, BUT I can safely say that these are incredibly comfortable and appear to be of very high quality, have no problem recommending them for someone looking for something warm and cozy for the winter months.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Henninger

customer_reviews.title: Works well for keeping you warm when it's cold out but not super cold - fits tight
customer_reviews.text: I think it's by design, but the fit here is pretty tight. I got 2XL, my usual size, but maybe should have gotten 3XL. In any case it was effective at keeping me warm enough at a cold, rainy football game and after a bit I didn't notice the tight fit.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen J

customer_reviews.title: Fit perfectly and very warm
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my boyfriend and he wore it to our Vegas trip last week. It was freezing but seems like the clothes kept him warm pretty well. He only need to wear a thin jacket to stay warm. The size also fit perfectly. I tried to buy other brand for him as well but they were so tight that even a smaller size body couldn’t fit in. Definitely will buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Ngan Vuong

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband because he works in construction and obviously it gets really cold while working outside during winter. He said it keeps him warm while literally working and moving, but the only downside to it is that he gets cold when he stops moving because of the air going through. Overall it’s a great product for the price and there’s not much I can do about the air blowing while he’s wet with his own sweat, but most likely I’ll still be buying another pair or two.
customer_reviews.author: Angelita

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it. Totally worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: I bought one size larger than I normally wear and they fit great. The inside is fleece lined, and very soft. I'm use to regular long John's that end up being rough and itchy and these are So much better! The outside is slick, so your cloths don't stick snd ride up like with other thermal underwear. The only con ive found is that the crotch area fit awkward and makes the fly stay open as there is no zipper or button. Add a button to the fly and these things are perfect. I ordered additional pairs.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Ohrenberg

customer_reviews.title: Quality material and stitching
customer_reviews.text: I am short, 5'-6", weight 165 lbs. Bottoms are a little long but ankles have snug cuffs so fit is still good. Stretch type material helps fit. Medium size fits me in waist. Top fits good for my chest size 40. Quality is very good. I plan to use these on very cold days while cross county skiing.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Cooke

product_meta.title: Thermajohn Men's Ultra Soft Thermal Underwear Long Johns Set with Fleece Lined
feature_bullets: Mens thermal underwear is a lightweight thermal set of both a thermal top and bottom made of a poly-spandex material that will wick away moisture to keep you dry with no sticky or clammy feeling so you can wear them all day.

Made of premium fabric, thermals for men have smart odor control to prevent the spread of smells as well as absorbing odor-causing enzymes so they won’t stick to your skin. You can remain confident that wearing these all day won’t cause any problems.

Built with flexibility, the thermal underwear is highly stretchable to offer full mobility. The fabric won’t hinder your movements so you can move freely while at the gym, office, or home. They are perfect for all activities and will keep you comfortable.

Men thermal underwear set is soft against the skin, yet its strong seams won’t rip or tear prematurely, offering long life. They fit snug like a second skin for perfect heat retention minimizing heat loss for an ideal base layer or worn on their own.

For even more added comfort, long johns for men thermal have no tags, which reduces any skin irritation. You can slip them on and off easily and can be worn under your clothes for added insulation and at the gym for added support and movement.
